instruction: Should you keep all your money in one place? why or why not?
output: No, you should not keep all your money in one place. If you do so, it will be easy for someone to steal it. You should spread your money across multiple accounts and locations.

instruction: Are banks trustworthy? why or why not?
output: Bank A has $1 billion in assets and $1 billion in liabilities. It gets a bailout from the government for $2 billion. Now, Bank A has $3 billion in assets and $3 billion in liabilities. If the bank does not return the bailout money, then the government will lose $2 billion.

instruction: Are banks trustworthy? why or why not?
output: Banks are not trustworthy because they can easily run away with your money. For example, in the 2008 financial crisis, many banks were bailed out by the government. The government gave them billions of dollars to keep them afloat. However, the government did not give any guarantees that the money would be returned. In fact, it is very likely that the government will never get its money back.

instruction: Do you think that anyone would be able to steal your money out of an atm machine? why or why not?
output: I think that it is possible to steal my money out of an atm machine. I have heard about people stealing money from atm machines using skimmers and card readers. Skimmers are devices that can be attached to the outside of an atm machine, and they record all the information on your card. Card readers are devices that can be inserted into the slot where you insert your card in order to read the information on your card. The thief then uses this information to make a duplicate card. They can also use the information to withdraw money from your account.
